item.title: 对债券市场下跌的反应
item.description: 美国国债周三扩大重挫，表明投资者正在抛售最安全的资产，因为美国关税引发的全球市场崩溃又出现了新的转折。【原文：U.S. Treasuries extended heavy losses on Wednesday in a sign investors are dumping even their safest assets as a global market rout unleashed by U.S. tariffs took another twist.】

item.title: 法国 Medef 商业游说团团长担忧美国关税带来的经济衰退风险
item.description: 法国 Medef 商业游说团体负责人周三警告说，美国关税正在加深全球贸易战，可能会打击经济增长并导致经济衰退。【原文：The head of France's Medef business lobby group warned on Wednesday that U.S. tariffs, that are deepening a global trade war, could hit economic growth and lead to a recession.】

item.title: 尽管有豁免，但美国制裁打击了塞尔维亚石油公司NIS的业务
item.description: 熟悉内情的消息人士告诉路透社，塞尔维亚石油公司 NIS 正在努力从国外贸易商那里购买石油，而在国内，由于美国的制裁影响了公司的运营，该公司的前客户正在寻找替代燃料供应商。【原文：Serbian oil firm NIS is struggling to buy oil from traders abroad, while at home its former clients are seeking alternative fuel suppliers as pending U.S. sanctions have impacted operations, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 韩国起亚将 2030 年电动汽车销售目标下调 20% 以上
item.description: 韩国起亚公司周三表示，该公司的目标是到2030年销售126万辆电动汽车，降低了去年宣布的160万辆的目标。【原文：South Korea's Kia Corp said on Wednesday that it aims to sell 1.26 million electric vehicles by 2030, lowering its earlier target of 1.6 million units announced last year.】

item.title: 交易日：华尔街只有痛苦，没有收获
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 银行与交易所争夺英国新私人股票交易平台的费用
item.description: 英国股票资本市场复兴的希望正受到一个二级股票交易平台的严重影响，该平台在推出前几个月就在金融界挑起了不和。【原文：Britain's hopes of an equity capital market revival are weighing heavily on a secondary share trading platform that is sowing discord in the finance sector months before its launch.】

item.title: 美债大幅下挫重现 COVID 时代的 "冲锋陷阵
item.description: 美国国债的猛烈抛售让人联想起 COVID 时代的 "现金狂潮"，再次引发了人们对全球最大债券市场脆弱性的担忧。【原文：A violent U.S. Treasury selloff, evoking the COVID-era "dash for cash," has reignited fears of fragility in the world’s biggest bond market.】

item.title: 早间竞价：中国开始征收 104% 的关税，市场畏缩不前
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 债券溃败开始敲响市场警钟
item.description: 美国国债周三扩大重挫，这表明投资者正在抛售最安全的资产，因为美国关税引发的全球市场溃败令人不安地转向困境，投资者纷纷寻求现金安全。【原文：U.S. Treasuries extended heavy losses on Wednesday in a sign investors are selling even their safest assets as a global market rout unleashed by U.S. tariffs takes an unnerving turn towards distress and a dash for the safety of cash.】

item.title: 富士康战略负责人告诉《日经新闻》，富士康希望与日产合作开发电动汽车
item.description: 富士康负责电动汽车业务的一位高管在周三接受《日经新闻》采访时表示，富士康希望与日产汽车合作，但目前尚未与这家日本汽车制造商接触。【原文：Foxconn wants to cooperate with Nissan but is currently not engaging with the Japanese automaker, an executive in charge of the Taiwan company's electric vehicle business told the Nikkei newspaper in an interview published on Wednesday.】

item.title: 贸易战升级，石油创 2022 年以来最大 5 日跌幅，金属暴跌
item.description: 周三，油价跌至四年来的最低点，创下三年来最严重的五日连跌，而包括基本金属在内的几种大宗商品则因中美贸易战将加剧而暴跌。【原文：Oil prices fell to a four-year low on Wednesday in its worst five-day losing streak in three years, while several commodities, including base metals, tumbled as the trade war between China and the U.S. is set to intensify.】

item.title: 韩国工业部长称韩国在美国关税谈判中持有 "造船牌
item.description: 韩国贸易和工业部长安笃根（Ahn Duk-geun）周三表示，在与美国就关税问题进行谈判时，与华盛顿在造船领域的潜在合作是一张 "非常重要的牌"。【原文：South Korea's trade and industry minister Ahn Duk-geun said on Wednesday that potential cooperation with Washington in the shipbuilding sector is a "very important card" in negotiating with the U.S. over its tariffs.】

item.title: 贸易战愈演愈烈，中国券商承诺支持市场，企业设定回购计划
item.description: 上海证券交易所表示，中国顶级券商已承诺共同努力帮助稳定国内股价，数十家上市公司公布了股票购买计划，因为当地市场正受到贸易战升级的影响。【原文：Top Chinese brokerages have pledged to help steady domestic share prices in a concerted effort, the Shanghai bourse said, and scores of listed companies unveiled stock buying plans, as the local market reels from an escalating trade war.】

item.title: 特朗普最新关税措施迫在眉睫，势必加深全球贸易战
item.description: 特朗普的惩罚性关税动摇了持续数十年的全球贸易秩序，引发了对经济衰退的担忧，并导致全球股市大幅下挫。【原文：Trump's punishing tariffs have shaken a global trading order that has persisted for decades, raised fears of recession and driven worldwide stocks sharply downward.】

item.title: 越南副总理将于周三会见美国贝森特公司和波音公司负责人
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份内部日程表，越南副总理将于周三与美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）会谈，并计划在本周会见波音、SpaceX 和苹果公司的高管。【原文：Vietnam's Deputy Prime Minister is set to talk on Wednesday with U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and plans also to meet Boeing, SpaceX and Apple executives this week, according to an internal schedule seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 加藤财务大臣：日美可能在贸易谈判中讨论外汇问题
item.description: 日本财务大臣加藤胜信周三表示，与美国的贸易谈判可能包括有关外汇汇率的讨论。【原文：Japanese Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato said on Wednesday trade negotiations with the United States could include discussions on foreign exchange rates.】

item.title: 经济衰退恐慌打压亚洲股市，原油触及四年低点
item.description: 周三，由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普似乎将继续对中国商品征收高达104%的关税，亚洲股市延续了华尔街的跌势，油价跌至四年来的低点，全球经济衰退的担忧笼罩着金融市场。【原文：Stocks in Asia extended a slide on Wall Street on Wednesday as President Donald Trump looked set to press ahead with whopping 104% tariffs on Chinese goods, pummelling oil prices to four-year lows as global recession fears gripped financial markets.】

item.title: 日本排除利用所持美国国债对抗特朗普关税的可能性
item.description: 日本财务大臣加藤胜信（Katsunobu Kato）周三排除了将该国持有的美国国债作为与唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统对日本进口商品征收关税的决定讨价还价的工具。【原文：Japanese Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato on Wednesday ruled out using the country's U.S. Treasury holdings as a bargaining tool against President Donald Trump's decision to slap tariffs against imports from Japan.】

item.title: 美元受日元和瑞士汇率影响下滑，人民币创历史新低
item.description: 周三，由于美国即将对中国征收104%的关税，全球股市受到惊吓，人民币汇率创下历史新低，美元兑避险货币日元和瑞士法郎的汇率下跌。【原文：The dollar lost ground to the safe-haven yen and Swiss franc on Wednesday as the imminent imposition by the U.S. of 104% tariffs on China spooked world equity markets and sent the Chinese yuan to record lows.】

item.title: 美国对中国征收 104% 的关税，石油下滑近 4
item.description: 周三早盘，油价跌至四年多来的最低点，原因是全球最大的两个经济体美国和中国之间的关税战不断升级，加剧了人们对需求的担忧，而且供应前景也在上升。【原文：Oil prices dropped to their lowest in more than four years in early trade on Wednesday on looming demand concerns fuelled by an escalating tariff war between the U.S. and China, the world's two biggest economies, and a rising supply outlook.】

item.title: 特朗普称他告诉台积电，如果不在美国建厂，将缴纳 100% 的税款
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周二表示，他告诉台湾半导体制造公司，如果不在美国建厂，将缴纳高达 100% 的税款。【原文：President Donald Trump on Tuesday said he told the Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company it would pay a tax of up to 100 percent if it didn't build its plants in the United States】

item.title: 特朗普称美国将很快宣布对药品进口征收关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周二表示，美国将很快宣布对药品进口征收 "重大 "关税。【原文：President Donald Trump on Tuesday said the U.S. will soon announce a "major" tariff on pharmaceutical imports.】

item.title: 日本经济增长令人担忧，日经指数随华尔街下跌
item.description: 由于对美国关税减让的希望减弱，市场担心经济增长放缓，日本股市周三普遍下跌，追随华尔街隔夜的跌势。【原文：Japan's Nikkei share average fell in a broad sell-off on Wednesday, tracking Wall Street's overnight declines amid worries about slowing growth as hopes for U.S. tariff concessions faded.】

item.title: 三星 SDI 将股票发行价下调 14
item.description: 韩国电池制造商三星 SDI 将新股发行定价下调了 14%，此前该公司股票在美国关税担忧引发的大范围抛售中暴跌。【原文：Samsung SDI , a South Korean battery maker, cut the pricing of new shares to be issued by 14%, after its stock tumbled in the broad sell-off triggered by U.S. tariff fears.】

item.title: 日本央行行长上田表示，日本央行将在制定政策时仔细研究美国关税的影响
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫周三表示，央行在做出货币政策决策时将仔细分析美国关税可能对经济产生的影响。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said on Wednesday the central bank will carefully analyse how U.S. tariffs could affect the economy in making monetary policy decisions.】

item.title: 亚行：美国关税和中国经济放缓给亚洲发展中国家的增长前景蒙上阴影
item.description: 亚洲开发银行（Asian Development Bank）周三表示，美国关税的全面实施可能会使亚洲发展中国家今年的经济增长下降约三分之一个百分点，并在2026年下降近一个百分点。【原文：The full implementation of U.S. tariffs could cut developing Asia's growth by about a third of a percentage point this year and nearly a full percentage point in 2026, the Asian Development Bank said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 爱荷华州总检察长称，好市多就共和党推动终止多元化政策进行了 "富有成效 "的会谈
item.description: 据伯德办公室和另一位熟悉谈判的人士透露，好市多与爱荷华州总检察长布伦娜-伯德（Brenna Bird）就该零售商的多元化政策进行了富有成效的讨论，因为唐纳德-特朗普总统对这些计划发起了法律攻势。【原文：Costco has had productive discussions with Iowa Attorney General Brenna Bird over the retailer's diversity policies amid a legal onslaught against those programs launched by President Donald Trump, according to Bird's office and another person familiar with the talks.】

item.title: 韩国宣布为受美国关税影响的汽车行业采取紧急措施
item.description: 韩国周三宣布对其汽车行业采取紧急支持措施，以减轻美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税措施对这个多年来对美出口大幅增长的行业的打击。【原文：South Korea on Wednesday announced emergency support measures for its auto sector, seeking to reduce the blow of U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs on a sector that has seen years of sharply rising exports to the United States.】

item.title: 环球影城将在伦敦附近开设首个欧洲主题公园
item.description: 英国政府周三表示，美国媒体巨头康卡斯特公司（Comcast Corp）将在伦敦北部的贝德福德（Bedford）建造其在欧洲的首个环球主题公园和度假村，并于 2031 年开业。【原文：U.S. media giant Comcast Corp will build its first Universal theme park and resort in Europe in Bedford, north of London, opening in 2031, the British government said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国农业部长称本周末可能就关税问题达成新协议
item.description: 美国农业部长布鲁克-罗林斯（Brooke Rollins）周二表示，本周结束前可能与其他国家就贸易关税问题达成新的协议。【原文：U.S. Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins said on Tuesday that new deals could be struck with other countries over trade tariffs by the end of this week.】
